unnormalised: I’m trying to understand health insurance identifiers better. Specifically, what exactly are UHIDs and Arogya IDs? I’ve heard bits and pieces but nothing concrete. My family is constantly dealing with hospital visits in Mumbai, and frankly, keeping track of everyone's medical records is a nightmare.
normalised: I am trying to understand health insurance identifiers better. Specifically, what exactly are U-H-I-Ds and Arogya I-Ds? I have heard bits and pieces but nothing concrete. My family is constantly dealing with hospital visits in Mumbai, and frankly, keeping track of everyone's medical records is a nightmare.

unnormalised: My father has a UHID: 123456789012, which I understand is a Unique Health ID. He got it when he visited Lilavati Hospital last year for a check-up related to his diabetes. The staff mentioned it helps them track his medical history across different visits. Apparently, it's linked to his Aadhaar card, though he hasn't officially linked them online yet. He also has a separate health insurance policy from ICICI Lombard, the policy number is HL/2023/000000. I’m still confused about how these all connect.
normalised: My father has a U-H-I-D: one two three four five six seven eight nine zero one two, which I understand is a Unique Health I-D. He got it when he visited Lilavati Hospital last year for a check-up related to his diabetes. The staff mentioned it helps them track his medical history across different visits. Apparently, it is linked to his Aadhaar card, though he has not officially linked them online yet. He also has a separate health insurance policy from I-C-I-C-I Lombard, the policy number is H-L slash two thousand and twenty three slash zero zero zero zero zero zero. I am still confused about how these all connect.

unnormalised: Then there's this Arogya ID. My mother got one when she participated in a health camp organized by the local municipality. Her Arogya ID is ARID2024MUM00000001. They said it would help her access government health schemes. I’m unsure if the UHID and Arogya ID serve the same purpose or if they cater to different aspects of healthcare management.
normalised: Then there is this Arogya I-D. My mother got one when she participated in a health camp organized by the local municipality. Her Arogya I-D is A-R-I-D two thousand and twenty four M-U-M zero zero zero zero zero zero zero one. They said it would help her access government health schemes. I am unsure if the U-H-I-D and Arogya I-D serve the same purpose or if they cater to different aspects of healthcare management.

unnormalised: Basically, I want to know if these IDs are interchangeable. Can I use my father's UHID instead of his insurance policy number, or vice versa? What are the practical differences and benefits of each? Knowing this would really simplify things when dealing with hospitals and insurance claims in the future. Any insights from folks who've navigated this system would be greatly appreciated.
normalised: Basically, I want to know if these I-Ds are interchangeable. Can I use my father's U-H-I-D instead of his insurance policy number, or vice versa? What are the practical differences and benefits of each? Knowing this would really simplify things when dealing with hospitals and insurance claims in the future. Any insights from folks who have navigated this system would be greatly appreciated.
